snippet: Airline employees say that among their passengers using wheelchairs, they regularly see some who do not need them but instead ask for them to avoid long waits at airports.
abstract: AIrline employees report that some able-bodied travelers are exploiting a federal law that requires wheelchairs to be given to those who request them, and are using them as a way to speed through long lines and airport security.
lead_paragraph: Airline employees say that among their passengers using wheelchairs, they regularly see some who do not need them but instead ask for them to avoid long waits at airports.

headline.seo: A Few Passengers Use Wheelchairs to Avoid Airport Lines
headline.main: Rolling Past a Line, Often by Exploiting a Rule
headline.print_headline: Rolling Past a Line, Often by Exploiting a Rule
